intro: Neurocarpaea arvensis var. violacea, commonly known as the violet-leaved field neurocarpaea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and finely divided, bluish-green leaves. Its flowers are small and white or pale violet, arranged in umbrella-like clusters, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. The species is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows.
